derivation.yuyuan_name: early 17th cent.: from French révision or late Latin revisio(n-), from the verb revisere 'look at again' (see revise)

entry.def: To make a revision of something that is written or something that has been decided means to make changes to it in order to improve it, make it more modern, or make it more suitable for a particular purpose.

example.ex: The phase of writing that is actually most important is revision...
example.tran: 实际上写作过程中最重要的阶段是修改。

example.ex: A major addition to the earlier revisions of the questionnaire is the job requirement exercise.
example.tran: 之前对问卷的修改主要是增加了一些和工作要求有关的问题。

entry.def: When people who are studying do revision, they read things again and make notes in order to prepare for an examination.

example.ex: Some girls prefer to do their revision at home.
example.tran: 有些女孩更愿意在家复习功课。

means.word_mean: 1. the act of revising or altering (involving reconsideration and modification);

sentences.sentence: "it would require a drastic revision of his opinion"

means.word_mean: 3. something that has been written again;

Sentence.sentence: But the worst part is that print version of textbooks are constantly undergoing revisions.

sentences.en: At any rate, your plan needs revision.
sentences.cn: 不管怎样, 你的计划需要加以修订。

sentences.en: I have got the revision of his dictionary.
sentences.cn: 我得到了他编的词典的修订本。

sentences.en: She did some revision for the exam.

jushi.english: This is a book of four revisions.
jushi.chinese: 这是本经过4次校订的书。

jushi.english: At any rate,your plan needs revision.
jushi.chinese: 不管怎样，你的计划需要加以修订。

jushi.english: A revision of that book will soon be published.
jushi.chinese: 那书的修订本即将出版。
